Interview English

ì˜ì–´ë¡œ ì¸í„°ë·°ëŠ” ì²˜ìŒì´ë¼, ì¸í„°ë·° ê³¼ì •ì—ì„œ ì‚¬ìš©í• ë§Œí•œ ì˜ì–´ í‘œí˜„ë“¤ì„ ì—°ìŠµí–ˆë‹¤.

ì´ì™¸ ì¤‘ìš”í•˜ê²Œ ì—°ìŠµí–ˆë˜ ê²ƒì€ ì˜ì–´ ë°œìŒê³¼ ì¸í† ë„¤ì´ì…˜ êµì •ì´ë‹¤. í•™êµì—ì„œ ì§„í–‰í•˜ëŠ” 1:1 Zoom íšŒìƒ ì˜ì–´ë¥¼ í†µí•´ì„œ ì´ ë¶€ë¶„ì€ ë§ì´ êµì • ë°›ì•˜ë‹¤.

  • What should I say when I miss a question?

    • Unfortunately, Iâ€™ve not come across this â€˜phraseâ€™ before in my study, so I donâ€™t feel confident giving a good answer. I would like to look into it further to help me develop myself later on.
    • I donâ€™t know but Iâ€™d like to find out.

  • If there is an internet connection problem

    • Iâ€™m sorry our connection is not great, could you please repeat the question?

  • What should I say when I need time to think?

    • Oh, thatâ€™s an interesting/great/good question. Could you give me some more time to give you a good answer? Oh, let me think about that.

  • What pillars sound natural for reacting to the questions/words?

    • Alright!
    • Yeah!
    • Let me think about it. Umm..

  • Great for the panel

    • Hello! So lovely to be speaking with you today. Thank you for taking the time to interview me. This is a great opportunity.

  • End of interview.

    • Once again, Iâ€™d like to thank you for interviewing me. I hope I answered all your questions well. I look forward to hearing from you soon.
